secText:
Lesson:
1. Explore [OBJ:actsec_m354:simple harmonic motion] using air hockey.
2. Define [OBJ:expsec_m355:simple harmonic motion] and the restoring force.
3. [OBJ:expsec_m357:Graph] simple harmonic motion.
4. Define [OBJ:expsec_m356:cycles] in simple harmonic motion.
5. Define [OBJ:expsec_m358:amplitude] in simple harmonic motion.
6. Define and calculate [OBJ:expsec_m360:period] in simple harmonic motion.
7. Define and calculate [OBJ:expsec_m362:frequency] in simple harmonic motion.
8. Compare and contrast the [OBJ:expsec_m366:frequencies of real-world objects].
9. Explore [OBJ:actsec_m361:graphing simple harmonic motion] using air hockey.
10. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_graph_this_shm_question:create a position-time graph] of an object in simple harmonic motion.
11. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_could_this_f_make_shm_question:determine if an object is moving in simple harmonic motion].

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_37014:Analyze] a graph to determine the amplitude of an object in simple harmonic motion.
2. [OBJ:qc_37008:Analyze] a graph to determine the period of an object in simple harmonic motion.
3. [OBJ:qc_37010:Analyze] a graph to determine the frequency of an object in simple harmonic motion.
